title: Buffer underflow in sprintf
vulnerability_information:
Hi,

So I found this in mruby as part of the shopify-scripts program, and I notice that my patch also landed upstream in ruby as well. Shame on me for not checking ruby as well!

Wondered if it counted for a bounty here as well?

https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3347 <- issue that shopify guys opened on my behalf.
https://github.com/ruby/ruby/commit/0854193a684acc2b3a13ab28091a4397000c8822 <- commit landed upstream.

https://hackerone.com/reports/191328 (still open so not public) is the original report of mine.

Let me know if you need anything more.

Cheers,

Hugh
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

So I found this in mruby as part of the shopify-scripts program, and I notice that my patch also landed upstream in ruby as well. Shame on me for not checking ruby as well!

Wondered if it counted for a bounty here as well?

https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3347 <- issue that shopify guys opened on my behalf.
https://github.com/ruby/ruby/commit/0854193a684acc2b3a13ab28091a4397000c8822 <- commit landed upstream.

https://hackerone.com/reports/191328 (still open so not public) is the original report of mine.

Let me know if you need anything more.

Cheers,

Hugh

activities.message:
Crashfile would be this:

```
sprintf("%1$*1$c",0)
```

Still a problem on `2.3.3p224`.

```
$ ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb
[BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x007fe75a800000
ruby 2.3.3p224 (2016-11-24 revision 56888) [x86_64-darwin15]

-- Crash Report log information --------------------------------------------
   See Crash Report log file under the one of following:
     * ~/Library/Logs/CrashReporter
     * /Library/Logs/CrashReporter
     * ~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports
     * /Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports
   for more details.
Don't forget to include the above Crash Report log file in bug reports.

-- Control frame information -----------------------------------------------
^Cruby(59715,0x700000005000) malloc: *** error for object 0x7fe7590ff808: incorrect checksum for freed object - object was probably modified after being freed.
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
SEGV received in SEGV handler
Abort trap: 6

```

The `^C` was a hang while printing the info, then interrupt.

It sometimes hangs there, sometimes before printing anything.

```
$ ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb
^Cruby(73591,0x700000005000) malloc: *** error for object 0x7ff58b011008: incorrect checksum for freed object - object was probably modified after being freed.
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
SEGV received in SEGV handler
Abort trap: 6

```

Sometimes it gets further, then hangs so much you need to SIGKILL it.

```
$ ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb
crash.rb:538976288: [BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x007fa36e100000
ruby 2.3.3p224 (2016-11-24 revision 56888) [x86_64-darwin15]

-- Crash Report log information --------------------------------------------
   See Crash Report log file under the one of following:
     * ~/Library/Logs/CrashReporter
     * /Library/Logs/CrashReporter
     * ~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports
     * /Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports
   for more details.
Don't forget to include the above Crash Report log file in bug reports.

-- Control frame information -----------------------------------------------
c:0003 p:---- s:0010 e:000009 CFUNC  :sprintf
c:0002 p:0010 s:0004 E:000e30 EVAL   crash.rb:538976288 [FINISH]
c:0001 p:0000 s:0002 E:001430 (none) [FINISH]

-- Ruby level backtrace information ----------------------------------------
crash.rb:538976288:in `<main>'
crash.rb:538976288:in `sprintf'

-- Machine register context ------------------------------------------------

 rdx: 0x00007fa36e003c60 rdi: 0x00007fa36e100000 rsi: 0x2020202020202020
 rbp: 0x00007fff5073c2e0 rsp: 0x00007fff5073c2e0  r8: 0x0000000000000040
  r9: 0x00007fa36bc21ec0 r10: 0x00000000000000af r11: 0x0000000000fb2d68
 r12: 0x00007fa36d050ec0 r13: 0xffffffffffffffff r14: 0xffffffffffffffff
 r15: 0x0000000000100000 rip: 0x00007fff9969ec49 rfl: 0x0000000000010286

-- C level backtrace information -------------------------------------------
0   ruby                                0x000000010f66bd04 rb_vm_bugreport + 388

2   ruby                                0x000000010f5da5c3 sigsegv + 83

[1]+  Stopped                 ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb

20:03 $ kill -9 %1
[1]+  Killed: 9               ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb

```

And sometimes it gets fully through printing it.

Fixed on trunk, most likely due to patch mentioned in first comment:

```
$ ./2.4.0-dev/bin/ruby --version
ruby 2.4.0dev (2016-12-18 trunk 57108) [x86_64-darwin15]

$ ./2.4.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb

$
```

activities.message:
lldb output:


```
$ lldb ./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby crash.rb
(lldb) target create "./2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby"
Current executable set to './2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby' (x86_64).
(lldb) settings set -- target.run-args  "crash.rb"
(lldb) r
Process 50382 launched: './2.3.0-dev/bin/ruby' (x86_64)
Process 50382 stopped
* thread #1: tid = 0x625301, 0x00007fff9969ec49 libsystem_platform.dylib`_platform_bzero$VARIANT$Haswell + 41, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x101c00000)
    frame #0: 0x00007fff9969ec49 libsystem_platform.dylib`_platform_bzero$VARIANT$Haswell + 41
libsystem_platform.dylib`_platform_bzero$VARIANT$Haswell:
->  0x7fff9969ec49 <+41>: rep
    0x7fff9969ec4a <+42>: stosb  %al, %es:(%rdi)
    0x7fff9969ec4b <+43>: movq   %rdx, %rax
    0x7fff9969ec4e <+46>: popq   %rbp
(lldb) x/7i $rip-5
    0x7fff9969ec44: f0        lock
    0x7fff9969ec45: 48 89 fa  movq   %rdi, %rdx
    0x7fff9969ec48: fc        cld
->  0x7fff9969ec49: f3        rep
    0x7fff9969ec4a: aa        stosb  %al, %es:(%rdi)
    0x7fff9969ec4b: 48 89 d0  movq   %rdx, %rax
    0x7fff9969ec4e: 5d        popq   %rbp
(lldb) bt
* thread #1: tid = 0x625301, 0x00007fff9969ec49 libsystem_platform.dylib`_platform_bzero$VARIANT$Haswell + 41, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x101c00000)
  * frame #0: 0x00007fff9969ec49 libsystem_platform.dylib`_platform_bzero$VARIANT$Haswell + 41
    frame #1: 0x000000010011b0d8 ruby`rb_str_format + 6632
    frame #2: 0x00000001001a086a ruby`vm_call_cfunc + 314
    frame #3: 0x00000001001899ac ruby`vm_exec_core + 11836
    frame #4: 0x000000010019aec3 ruby`vm_exec + 115
    frame #5: 0x000000010004d778 ruby`ruby_exec_internal + 152
    frame #6: 0x000000010004d686 ruby`ruby_run_node + 54
    frame #7: 0x0000000100000e8f ruby`main + 79
    frame #8: 0x00007fff8be095ad libdyld.dylib`start + 1
(lldb) q
Quitting LLDB will kill one or more processes. Do you really want to proceed: [Y/n] y

```

So that shows we have some write happening. Unsure whether we can control it or not though.

Cheers,

Hugh

    frame #7: 0x0000000100000e8f ruby`main + 79
    frame #8: 0x00007fff8be095ad libdyld.dylib`start + 1
(lldb) q
Quitting LLDB will kill one or more processes. Do you really want to proceed: [Y/n] y

So that shows we have some write happening. Unsure whether we can control it or not though.

Cheers,

Hugh
